column2: A new Chinese Imperial bloodline will be founded.
A new pretender Chinese Imperial bloodline will be founded.

I now control China, and thus the Mandate of Heaven clearly belongs to me. As I did not claim the Mandate of Heaven prior to coming into possession of the Dragon Throne, I have yet to name my imperial dynasty, and this is not something I can postpone.\nBeing quite familiar with Chinese history, I do of course know quite a bit about previous Chinese dynasties, and perhaps picking a name belonging to a previous dynasty that achieved great things would be a wise course of action, but I could pick a different name if that feels more appropriate.\nWhat will the name of my dynasty be?

[From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, now possesses the Dragon Throne, and has seen fit to claim the Mandate of Heaven, which hardly is surprising.\nHaving made the customary sacrifices to heaven and earth, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has decreed that [From.GetHerHis] imperial dynasty will be known as [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], and [From.GetHerHis] supporters are already proclaiming that the new dynasty will last for ten thousand years and that both civilized foreigners and uncivilized barbarians should make sure to respect the will of the Dragon Throne.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

[From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, now possesses the Dragon Throne. [From.GetSheHeCap] previously claimed the Mandate of Heaven, but was previously viewed as a mere pretender by many, which likely will change as of now.\nThe subjects of [From.GetBestName] have renewed their claims that the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty will last for ten thousand years, and are calling for both civilized foreigners and uncivilized barbarians to respect the will of the Dragon Throne.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

I have claimed the Mandate of Heaven, seeing as it clearly belongs to me and none other, and now I need to name my imperial dynasty, as is customary.\nI am quite familiar with Chinese history, and I could perhaps name my dynasty after a previous dynasty that achieved great things, though that is far from the only option available to me, and perhaps I should pick another name so that none would confuse my achievements or those of my successors with those of another dynasty.\nWhat will the name of my dynasty be?

[From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, has seen fit to claim the Mandate of Heaven despite not being in possession of the Dragon Throne, and has decreed that [From.GetHerHis] imperial dynasty will be known as [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName].\nThose who are familiar with Chinese history know that there have been many supposedly legitimate Chinese dynasties that never amounted to anything, but whether this will be the case for the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty is of course unknown, and [From.GetBestName]'s subjects seem convinced [From.GetHerHis] dynasty will rule for ten thousand years.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has seen fit to not only renounce [From.GetHerHis] loyalty to the Dragon Throne and my dynasty but to claim the Mandate of Heaven, evidently feeling that the current situation is suitable for such a move.\nThis is obviously not in the interests of me or my dynasty, and it should be clear to everyone that [From.GetBestName] does not possess the Mandate of Heaven, but doubtlessly there will be those that think that the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty is legitimate, and I should preferably deal with the situation sooner rather than later.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has seen fit to not only renounce [From.GetHerHis] loyalty to the Dragon Throne and my dynasty but to claim the Mandate of Heaven, evidently feeling that the current situation is suitable for such a move.\nThis is obviously not in the interests of me or my dynasty, and it should be clear to everyone that [From.GetBestName] does not possess the Mandate of Heaven, but doubtlessly there will be those that think that the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty is legitimate, and I should preferably deal with the situation sooner rather than later.

I have inherited [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] from [FromFromFrom.GetBestName], who claimed the Mandate of Heaven, which is a Chinese custom quite different from those of my culture. If I wish to maintain the claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven, I need to adopt foreign ways.
Chinese ways are not for me!

I have inherited [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] from [FromFromFrom.GetBestName], who claimed the Mandate of Heaven, which is a Chinese custom quite different from those of my faith. If I wish to maintain the claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven, I need to convert.
Chinese ways are not for me!

[From.GetBestName], the ruler of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], has chosen to abandon [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName]'s claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven despite being in a position to continue the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty.\nIt seems as if [From.GetBestName] made this decision due to not wishing to adopt Chinese ways, preferring to instead keep [From.GetHerHis] old ways, even though there doubtlessly are those that would say that this is a very questionable decision.
[From.GetSheHeCap] never possessed the Mandate of Heaven!

[From.GetBestName], the ruler of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], has chosen to abandon [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName]'s claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven despite being in a position to continue the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty.\nIt seems as if [From.GetBestName] made this decision due to not wishing to adopt Chinese ways, preferring to instead keep [From.GetHerHis] old ways, even though there doubtlessly are those that would say that this is a very questionable decision.
I don't care to seize the Mandate of Heaven!

column3: [From.GetBestName], the ruler of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], has chosen to abandon [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName]'s claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven despite being in a position to continue the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty.\nIt seems as if [From.GetBestName] made this decision due to [From.GetHerHis] ways being wholly incompatible with those expected of a would-be ruler of the Middle Kingdom and [From.GetHerHim] preferring [From.GetHerHis] own ways.

column2: [From.GetSheHeCap] never possessed the Mandate of Heaven!

I have inherited [Root.GetOldChinaName] from [FromFromFrom.GetBestName], who claimed to possess the Mandate of Heaven. I could use this opportunity to establish my own Chinese Imperial dynasty, but I could also set aside these pretensions if I have no desire to possess the Dragon Throne, or if I have no desire to make this publicly known.
The Mandate of Heaven is mine!

Having decided to found my own Chinese Imperial dynasty, it is of course necessary for me to decide on a name for it prior to making the customary sacrifices to heaven and earth.\nBeing familiar with Chinese history, I can think of several possible names, of course, but I need to consider whether to use a name that would bring a prior dynasty to mind or one that is different.\nWhat will the name of my my dynasty be?

Choosing to follow in the footsteps of the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty, [From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, has seen fit to claim the Mandate of Heaven and to proclaim the start of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty.\nWhether this new dynasty will make good of [From.GetBestName]'s claim is as of yet unknown, but there are those that already claim that the dynasty will last for ten thousand years and that both civilized foreigners and uncivilized barbarians should bow before the new [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

Though there are those that would say that [From.GetBestName] was in a most excellent position to claim the Mandate of Heaven following the end of the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty [From.GetSheHe] has not chosen to do so, and has instead seen fit to set aside all such pretensions.\nThough there probably are those that will question the wisdom of such a move, rumor has it that [From.GetBestName] seems quite convinced that this is for the best. History will decide whether that is the case, and [From.GetHerHis] successors might perhaps choose a different path.
[From.GetSheHeCap] never possessed the Mandate of Heaven!

[FromFromFrom.GetBestName] claimed to possess the Mandate of Heaven, and there are those that would have decided to follow in [FromFromFrom.GetHerHis] footsteps in my position. However, I do not care for Chinese ways, and thus I see little value in continuing these pretensions.\nLet it be known that the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty is at an end, and that its pretensions have come to an end!
I don't care to seize the Mandate of Heaven!

Having come to rule after [FromFromFromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] of the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty, there were those that expected that [From.GetBestName] would have seen fit to proclaim the founding of a new Chinese Imperial dynasty and that the Mandate of Heaven belonged to [From.GetHerHim], but this did not come to pass.\n[From.GetBestName] did instead proclaim an end to the pretensions of [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName], and added that [From.GetSheHe] had little interest in Chinese ways or customs, including there being such a thing as the Mandate of Heaven.
[From.GetSheHeCap] never possessed the Mandate of Heaven!

[From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, has inherited the Dragon Throne from [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName], and has seen fit to revive the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty and its claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven.\n[From.GetBestName] has made the customary sacrifices to heaven and earth already, and [From.GetHerHis] faithful subjects have declared that all civilized foreigners and uncivilized barbarians should bow before the Dragon Throne. Whether [From.GetHerHis] dynasty will last for ten thousand years, or whether reviving it was a mistake, will be decided by history.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

Having inherited the Dragon Throne, it is clear that the Mandate of Heaven belongs to me, and I have ordered preparations to be made for the customary sacrifices to heaven and earth. All that remains is for me to decide on the name of my imperial dynasty.\nI am quite familiar with Chinese history, of course, and perhaps picking the name of a dynasty of old would be appealing, but I could also pick a different name to avoid the risk of anyone confusing my achievements and those of my successors for those of another dynasty.\nWhat will the name of my dynasty be?

[From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, has inherited the Dragon Throne, and has taken the opportunity to claim the Mandate of Heaven and to proclaim the birth of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty.\nRumor has it [From.GetBestName]'s subjects are already claiming that the new dynasty will reign for ten thousand years and that all civilized foreigners and uncivilized barbarians should make sure to respect the will of the Dragon Throne. History will decide whether [From.GetBestName]'s dynasty actually lives up to expectations.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

I have inherited the Dragon Throne, and unlike [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] I know that Chinese customs are right and proper. As such, I have ordered the customary sacrifices to heaven and earth to be made, seeing as it is clear that I possess the Mandate of Heaven and that this is the start of a new Chinese Imperial dynasty.\nMy knowledge of Chinese history is extensive enough that I can think of several options for the name of my dynasty, and now I need to pick one of those names, whether one used by a previous dynasty or something completely different.\nWhat will the name of my dynasty be?

[From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, has inherited the Dragon Throne from [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName]. Unlike the previous ruler, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has an interest in Chinese ways, and [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to claim the Mandate of Heaven and to proclaim the start of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty.\nHistory will determine whether [From.GetBestName] truly possessed the Mandate of Heaven, but at present [From.GetSheHe] seems to at least have convinced [From.GetHerHis] subjects, as they are claiming that the new dynasty will last for ten thousand years.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

I have inherited the Dragon Throne, and unlike [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] I know that Chinese customs are right and proper. As such, I have ordered the customary sacrifices to heaven and earth to be made, seeing as it is clear that I possess the Mandate of Heaven and that this is the start of a new Chinese Imperial dynasty.\nMy knowledge of Chinese history is extensive enough that I can think of several options for the name of my dynasty, and now I need to pick one of those names, whether one used by a previous dynasty or something completely different.\nWhat will the name of my dynasty be?

[From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, has inherited the Dragon Throne from [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName]. Unlike the previous ruler, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has an interest in Chinese ways, and [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to claim the Mandate of Heaven and to proclaim the start of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty.\nHistory will determine whether [From.GetBestName] truly possessed the Mandate of Heaven, but at present [From.GetSheHe] seems to at least have convinced [From.GetHerHis] subjects, as they are claiming that the new dynasty will last for ten thousand years.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

I have inherited the Dragon Throne from [FromFromFrom.GetBestName], and it is clear that the Mandate of Heaven belongs to me. However, seeing as I already belonged to a Chinese Imperial dynasty, I now need to decide whether to continue this dynasty or to instead continue the previous dynasty.
My dynasty is the true dynasty!

Though once claiming that the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty was the one and only true Chinese dynasty and that its claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven was only right and proper, it seems [From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven has had a change of heart after inheriting the Dragon Throne.\n[From.GetTitledFirstName] has seen fit to proclaim the continuation of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty, acknowledging that [From.GetHerHis] old pretensions were incorrect but that [From.GetSheHe] and [From.GetHerHis] successors still will reign for ten thousand years.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

Having inherited the Dragon Throne, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has seen fit to continue the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty instead of continuing the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty when in the position to claim that either dynasty possessed the Mandate of Heaven.\nHistory will decide whether this course of action was the right one, but at the moment [From.GetBestName]'s subjects all seem to be convinced that it was a wise course of action, as they are claiming that the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty will reign for ten thousand years.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!
I have inherited the Dragon Throne from another Chinese Imperial dynasty, and it is clear that this means that my Chinese Imperial dynasty possesses the Mandate of Heaven.

[From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, has inherited the Dragon Throne from the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty despite belonging to the rival [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty, and [From.GetHerHis] claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven is considered quite a bit stronger than it was.\nTo the surprise of nobody, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has seen fit to proclaim the continuation of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty, and [From.GetHerHis] subjects are claiming that the dynasty will rule for ten thousand years.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

I have inherited the Dragon Throne, and unlike [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] I know that this means the Mandate of Heaven belongs to me. In the past, there have been those that have doubted my claim that it already did, but hopefully this will put an end to all such doubts.

[From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, has long claimed that the Mandate of Heaven belonged to [From.GetHerHim], which at times has been doubted by various people. However, seeing as [From.GetSheHe] now possesses the Dragon Throne, these claims seem more likely to many.\nAlready, [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s subjects are claiming that the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty will last for ten thousand years, and they are also making it clear that all civilized foreigners and uncivilized barbarians should respect the will of the Dragon Throne.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

I have inherited the Dragon Throne, and unlike [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] I know that this means the Mandate of Heaven belongs to me. In the past, there have been those that have doubted my claim that it already did, but hopefully this will put an end to all such doubts.

[From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, has long claimed that the Mandate of Heaven belonged to [From.GetHerHim], which at times has been doubted by various people. However, seeing as [From.GetSheHe] now possesses the Dragon Throne, these claims seem more likely to many.\nAlready, [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s subjects are claiming that the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty will last for ten thousand years, and they are also making it clear that all civilized foreigners and uncivilized barbarians should respect the will of the Dragon Throne.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

I have inherited [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] from [FromFromFrom.GetBestName], who claimed the Mandate of Heaven, which is a Chinese custom quite different from those of my culture. If I wish to maintain the claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven, I need to adopt foreign ways.
Chinese ways are not for me!

I have inherited [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] from [FromFromFrom.GetBestName], who claimed the Mandate of Heaven, which is a Chinese custom quite different from those of my faith. If I wish to maintain the claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven, I need to convert.
Chinese ways are not for me!

Despite possessing the Dragon Throne and being in an excellent position to continue the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty, [From.GetBestName] has chosen to not claim the Mandate of Heaven, which perhaps is unsurprising as [From.GetSheHe] does not care for Chinese ways.\nWhether this will turn out to have been a wise more, and whether [From.GetHerHis] descendants will feel the same way, will be decided by history, and perhaps this will embolden any others that would claim that the Middle Kingdom and the Dragon Throne rightfully belong to them.
[From.GetSheHeCap] never possessed the Mandate of Heaven!

I have inherited the Dragon Throne, and though many would expect me to claim that this means that I possess the Mandate of Heaven I have little interest in Chinese customs and no intention of making any such claims.
I don't care to seize the Mandate of Heaven!

Despite possessing the Dragon Throne and being in an excellent position to continue the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty, [From.GetBestName] has chosen to not claim the Mandate of Heaven, which perhaps is unsurprising as [From.GetSheHe] does not care for Chinese ways.\nWhether this will turn out to have been a wise more, and whether [From.GetHerHis] descendants will feel the same way, will be decided by history, and perhaps this will embolden any others that would claim that the Middle Kingdom and the Dragon Throne rightfully belong to them.
[From.GetSheHeCap] never possessed the Mandate of Heaven!

I have inherited the Dragon Throne, and though many would expect me to claim that this means that I possess the Mandate of Heaven I have little interest in Chinese customs and no intention of making any such claims.
I don't care to seize the Mandate of Heaven!

Though many who inherited the Dragon Throne from another dynasty would have taken the opportunity to proclaim a new Chinese Imperial dynasty and to claim the Mandate of Heaven, [From.GetBestName] has not seen fit to do so. This is perhaps unsurprising, seeing as [From.GetSheHe] does not care for Chinese ways.\nWhether this will turn out to have been a wise more, and whether [From.GetHerHis] descendants will feel the same way, will be decided by history, and perhaps this will embolden any others that would claim that the Middle Kingdom and the Dragon Throne rightfully belong to them.
[From.GetSheHeCap] never possessed the Mandate of Heaven!

I have dethroned [FromFromFrom.GetBestName], who claimed the Mandate of Heaven, which is a Chinese custom quite different from those of my culture. If I wish to maintain the claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven, I need to adopt foreign ways.
Chinese ways are not for me!

I have dethroned [FromFromFrom.GetBestName], who claimed the Mandate of Heaven, which is a Chinese custom quite different from those of my faith. If I wish to maintain the claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven, I need to convert.
Chinese ways are not for me!

Having dethroned [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName], it was expected that [From.GetBestName] would have claimed the Mandate of Heaven and would have continued the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty, but [From.GetBestName] has done no such thing, instead claiming that [From.GetSheHe] does not care for Chinese ways.\nHistory will decide whether this was a wise course of action or not, and perhaps [From.GetBestName]'s successors will regret this decision. Regardless, what is done is done, and [From.GetBestName] will have to live with the consequences.
[From.GetSheHeCap] never possessed the Mandate of Heaven!

Though many would have expected me to continue [FromFromFrom.GetBestName]'s pretensions to possess the Mandate of Heaven, I will do no such thing. I care little for Chinese customs, after all, and as such it would make little sense for me to make such claims, even if there are those that will not understand.\nPerhaps history will fault my decision, but I am quite confident that it is the right one, and trust that my successors will understand.
I don't care to seize the Mandate of Heaven!

Having dethroned [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName], it was expected that [From.GetBestName] would have claimed the Mandate of Heaven and would have continued the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty, but [From.GetBestName] has done no such thing, instead claiming that [From.GetSheHe] does not care for Chinese ways.\nHistory will decide whether this was a wise course of action or not, and perhaps [From.GetBestName]'s successors will regret this decision. Regardless, what is done is done, and [From.GetBestName] will have to live with the consequences.
[From.GetSheHeCap] never possessed the Mandate of Heaven!

I have dethroned [FromFromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], who claimed to possess the Mandate of Heaven, and am in a position to make a similar claim, even if there doubtlessly are those that would think me a mere pretender. I could also choose not to make any such claims.
The Mandate of Heaven is mine!

Having claimed the Mandate of Heaven, I need to decide what to name my Chinese Imperial dynasty so that the customary sacrifices to heaven and earth can be made.\nSeeing as I am familiar with Chinese history, I can think of several possible names for my dynasty, whether one that brings a previous dynasty to mind or one that will avoid any possible confusion as to which dynasty I and my successors belong to.\nWhat will the name of my dynasty be?

[From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, has proclaimed the end of the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty, but has elected to follow in its footsteps by claiming the Mandate of Heaven, having declared the founding of the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty.\nThough there are many that would dismiss this as mere pretensions, [From.GetBestName]'s subjects are already claiming that the new dynasty will last for ten thousand years and that [From.GetBestName] truly possesses the Mandate of Heaven. History will determine the validity of both claims.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

Though there are those that would have taken the opportunity to proclaim the founding of a new Chinese Imperial dynasty in [From.GetHerHis] position, [From.GetBestName] has seen fit to not claim the Mandate of Heaven following [From.GetHerHis] destruction of the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty.\nWhether this will turn out to have been a wise decision or not is for history to decide, and perhaps [From.GetBestName]'s own successors will disagree with the decision, but rumor has it [From.GetBestName] is convinced this was the only proper course of action.
[From.GetSheHeCap] never possessed the Mandate of Heaven!

Having dethroned [FromFromFrom.GetBestName], I am technically in a position to claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven and to declare the founding of a new Chinese Imperial dynasty. However, I care little for Chinese ways, and can see little benefit in such claims.\nPerhaps history will judge me harshly for this decision, and perhaps my successors will disagree with it, but I am determined not to claim the Mandate of Heaven, come what may.
I don't care to seize the Mandate of Heaven!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has elected to not follow in the footsteps of [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName] as far as claiming the Mandate of Heaven goes, even though many would have taken the opportunity to proclaim a new Chinese Imperial dynasty following the end of the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty.\nHistory will determine whether this was the proper course of action, but rumor has it that [From.GetBestName] is convinced that [From.GetSheHe] made the right decision, particularly as [From.GetSheHe] does not care about Chinese ways.
[From.GetSheHeCap] never possessed the Mandate of Heaven!

[From.GetBestName] has usurped the Dragon Throne from me, and in order to ensure that I am in no position to take it back [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to weaken my position in other ways as well, stripping away any other substantial titles and ordering any and all foreigners to cease paying tribute to me.

I have dethroned [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName], who claimed the Mandate of Heaven, which is a Chinese custom quite different from those of my culture. If I wish to maintain the claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven, I need to adopt foreign ways.
Chinese ways are not for me!

I have dethroned [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName], who claimed the Mandate of Heaven, which is a Chinese custom quite different from those of my faith. If I wish to maintain the claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven, I need to convert.
Chinese ways are not for me!

Despite the expectation that [From.GetTitledFirstName] would continue the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty and would maintain its claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven after [From.GetHerHis] usurpation of the Dragon Throne from [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName], [From.GetSheHe] has elected not to do this.\nThis is perhaps not entirely surprising, considering that [From.GetBestName] does not particularly care for Chinese customs, though many would have expected [From.GetHerHim] to adopt Chinese ways even so. Whether this will prove to be a mistake is for history to decide.
[From.GetSheHeCap] never possessed the Mandate of Heaven!

I have dethroned [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName], and there are those that would expect me to claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven as a result, seeing as I now possess the Dragon Throne. However, I have little interest in such Chinese customs, and I will make no such claims.\nDoubtlessly, there are those that will question this decision, and both history and my successors might judge me harshly for it, but I am convinced it is the right decision, and am prepared to live with the consequences, no matter what they are.
I don't care to seize the Mandate of Heaven!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has usurped the Dragon Throne from [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName], and most would have expected [From.GetHerHim] to continue to assert the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty's claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven. However, this has not come to pass.\nWord has it that [From.GetBestName] does not care for Chinese customs, and that [From.GetSheHe] thus sees little value in claiming the Mandate of Heaven. Whether this will turn out to have been a mistake or not is for history to decide.
[From.GetSheHeCap] never possessed the Mandate of Heaven!

I have usurped the Dragon Throne from [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName], and am technically in an excellent position to proclaim the founding of a new Chinese Imperial dynasty possessing the Mandate of Heaven. However, seeing as I care little for Chinese customs like that, I will not be doing so.\nI have little doubt that there will be a complete lack of people disagreeing with this decision, but I trust that history will justify it, and that my successors will not question it. If I turn out to have been wrong, then I will just have to live with the consequences.
I don't care to seize the Mandate of Heaven!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has usurped the Dragon Throne from [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName], and most would have expected [From.GetHerHim] to claim the Mandate of Heaven and to proclaim the founding of a new Chinese Imperial dynasty. However, this has not come to pass.\nWord has it that [From.GetBestName] does not care for Chinese customs, and that [From.GetSheHe] thus sees little value in claiming the Mandate of Heaven. Whether this will turn out to have been a mistake or not is for history to decide.
[From.GetSheHeCap] never possessed the Mandate of Heaven!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has usurped the Dragon Throne from [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName]. Unlike the previous ruler, [From.GetTitledFirstName] cares quite a bit about Chinese customs, and [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to revive the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty and its claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven.\n[From.GetBestName] has ordered the customary sacrifices to heaven and earth to be carried out, and [From.GetHerHis] subjects are already claiming that the dynasty will last for ten thousand years. Whether this will be the case is for history to decide.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

I now possess the Dragon Throne, and unlike [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName] I know this means I possess the Mandate of Heaven and that I should proclaim a new Chinese Imperial dynasty. I have already ordered the customary sacrifices to heaven and earth to be prepared, and now I need to decide on a name.\nSeeing as I am familiar with Chinese history, I can of course think of several options, and I need to decide whether to pick a name that evokes an old dynasty or something different that makes it clear that my achievements and those of my successors are those of my dynasty.\nWhat will the name of my dynasty be?

[From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, has usurped the Dragon Throne from [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName], and unlike the previous ruler [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to take the opportunity to claim the Mandate of Heaven and to proclaim the founding of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty.\nWhether [From.GetBestName]'s dynasty will endure or not will have to be seen, but [From.GetHerHis] subjects are already proclaiming that [From.GetBestName] and [From.GetHerHis] successors will reign for ten thousand years.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

I now possess the Dragon Throne, and unlike [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName] I know this means I possess the Mandate of Heaven. I have already ordered the customary sacrifices to heaven and earth to be carried out, and now I need to decide what the name of my dynasty will be.\nSeeing as I am not unfamiliar with Chinese history, I can of course think of several options, though whether to use the name of a famous dynasty of the past or a name that makes it impossible to confuse my dynasty with another is hard to say.\nWhat will the name of my dynasty be?

[From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, has usurped the Dragon Throne from [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName], and unlike the previous ruler [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to take the opportunity to claim the Mandate of Heaven and to proclaim the founding of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty.\nWhether [From.GetBestName]'s dynasty will endure or not will have to be seen, but [From.GetHerHis] subjects are already proclaiming that [From.GetBestName] and [From.GetHerHis] successors will reign for ten thousand years.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!
I care not about distant Cathay!

I have usurped the Dragon Throne from [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName], and now I need to decide whether to continue [old_emperor_of_china.GetHerHis] imperial dynasty or the dynasty I previously have claimed to belong to.
My dynasty is the true dynasty!

[From.GetTitledFirstName], the [From.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, has usurped the Dragon Throne from [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName], and has seen fit to continue the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty rather than the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty.\nWhether this will turn out to have been a wise move is for history to decide, but [From.GetBestName]'s subjects seem to be convinced that the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] will last for ten thousand years, and expect all civilized foreigners and uncivilized barbarians to respect the will of the Dragon Throne.
The Mandate of Heaven belongs to me!

It is well known that the heavenly [Root.GetTitledFirstName] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], the [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, claims to possess the Mandate of Heaven, and naturally both the common people of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and the wisest scholars in the world pay attention to this.\nAs things currently stand, it should be clear to all but utter fools that [Root.GetBestName]'s claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven is indisputable, and that anyone that would claim otherwise either is a fool or a liar\nOf course, this could well change in the future, as anyone that has studied Chinese history should be well aware...

Having inherited the empire of a [old_pretender_emperor.GetManWoman] who claimed to be the [old_pretender_emperor.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven and who came from my dynasty, there were those that expected me to follow in [old_pretender_emperor.GetHerHis] footsteps to claim the Mandate of Heaven. However, my realm is not remotely bureaucratic, and I currently have no interest in it being bureaucratic, and thus it would seem to be a mistake to make such a claim.\n\nSome will question the wisdom of this choice, no doubt, but for now I feel confident that it is the right move.

I have received word that [From.GetBestName] has elected not to follow in the footsteps of [old_pretender_emperor.GetBestName] when it comes to claiming to possess the Mandate of Heaven. Apparently, [From.GetSheHe] prefers to have a realm structured in a completely different manner than that of [old_pretender_emperor.GetBestName], and as such feels that it would be unwise to continue in a similar manner.\n\nDoubtlessly, there are those that will consider this a great mistake, but it is also very likely that there are those that will consider it a right and proper decision.

The sacrifices to heaven and earth are ready, but in order for it to be possible for them to commence I need to formally proclaim the name of my new imperial dynasty. I could elect to use a name that has been used to name one of the great dynasties of the past, even if the dynasty in question came to an end, or I could elect to use a different name to perhaps signify that my dynasty will not end in the same fashion.\n\nWhat will the name of the new imperial dynasty be?

I have been defeated, it is true. [new_eoc.GetBestName] now sits on the Dragon Throne, publicly claiming that [new_eoc.GetSheHe] possesses the Mandate of Heaven, that [new_eoc.GetSheHe] is the one and only true [new_eoc.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, that my [Root.GetOldChinaName] dynasty is over.\n\nSome would say I should accept what has happened, that the [Root.GetOldChinaName] dynasty truly has lost the Mandate of Heaven. Others, perhaps, would not. I am still able to govern, after all. Perhaps this was merely a temporary setback. Perhaps there are those that would come to my side, should I but call for them...
I still possess the Mandate of Heaven!
I have lost the Mandate of Heaven...

[new_eoc.GetBestName] might sit on the Dragon Throne, but it seems [From.GetBestName] merely considers that a temporary setback. [From.GetSheHeCap] has sent messages far and wide, calling for all those still loyal to the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty to rally to [From.GetHerHis] banner.\n\nIt seems the question as to who truly possesses the Mandate of Heaven still has to be settled. Perhaps it is [From.GetBestName] and [From.GetHerHis] [From.PrimaryTitle] dynasty. Perhaps it is [new_eoc.GetBestName] and [new_eoc.GetHerHis] [new_eoc.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty. Perhaps it is neither...
And here I thought you had learned better...
The Mandate still belongs to me!

[new_eoc.GetBestName] might sit on the Dragon Throne, but it seems [From.GetBestName] merely considers that a temporary setback. [From.GetSheHeCap] has sent messages far and wide, calling for all those still loyal to the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty to rally to [From.GetHerHis] banner.\n\nIt seems the question as to who truly possesses the Mandate of Heaven still has to be settled. Perhaps it is [From.GetBestName] and [From.GetHerHis] [From.PrimaryTitle] dynasty. Perhaps it is [new_eoc.GetBestName] and [new_eoc.GetHerHis] [new_eoc.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty. Perhaps it is neither...
Your dynasty has already lost the Mandate!
Your dynasty never possessed the Mandate!
I care not about distant Cathay!

[new_eoc.GetBestName] sits on the Dragon Throne, having proclaimed the [new_eoc.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty as the new imperial dynasty and the end of the [old_emperor_of_china_heir.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty. However, it seems [old_emperor_of_china_heir.GetBestName] does not agree that [old_emperor_of_china_heir.GetHerHis] dynasty has lost the Mandate of Heaven, as [old_emperor_of_china_heir.GetSheHe] has declared that [old_emperor_of_china_heir.GetHerHis] dynasty endures.\n\nI now need to decide whether I should support either of them... or whether I should take another, perhaps riskier path...

[new_eoc.GetBestName] now sits on the Dragon Throne, and [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName]'s dynasty clearly has lost the Mandate of Heaven, with none taking up their cause. As expected [new_eoc.GetBestName] has proclaimed a new imperial dynasty, the [new_eoc.PrimaryTitle] dynasty, and also claims to possess the Mandate of Heaven.\n\nDoubtlessly, many will support this claim, but perhaps not all, as a dynastic transition is not always a smooth affair. It seems [From.GetBestName] thinks that these interesting times are not interesting enough, seeing as [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to declare [From.GetHerHis] independence. Clearly, [From.GetSheHe] thinks I am in no position to punish this treachery...

Though such an event is far from common I have inherited the Middle Kingdom from [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName] despite not being part of [old_emperor_of_china.GetHerHis] dynasty. Continuing the [Root.GetOldChinaName] dynasty would not be viable, and I must therefore decide on the name of a new dynasty so that the customary sacrifices to heaven and earth can be carried out and my claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven can be made official.\n\nWhat shall I name my new dynasty?

[From.GetBestName] has inherited the Middle Kingdom from [old_emperor_of_china.GetBestName] despite not being part of the same dynasty, and has as such seen fit to proclaim this the beginning of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] dynasty rather than the continuation of the [From.GetOldChinaName] dynasty.
